question: Using a Callable would be more appropriate than using a Runnable in which of the following situations?
answer_1: When you want to execute a task directly in a separate thread
answer_2: When your task might throw a checked exception and you want to execute it in a separate Thread.
answer_3: When your task does not return any result but you want to execute the task asynchronously.
answer_4: When you want to use ExecutorService to submit multiple instances of a task.
correct_answer: When your task might throw a checked exception and you want to execute it in a separate Thread.

question: Given that a code fragment has just created a JDBC Connection and has executed an update statement, which of the following statements is correct?
answer_1: Changes to the database are pending a commit call on the connection.
answer_2: Changes to the database will be rolled back if another update is executed without commiting the previous update.
answer_3: Changes to the database will be committed right after the update statement has completed execution.
answer_4: Changes to the database will be committed when another query (update or select) is fired using the connection.
correct_answer: Changes to the database will be committed right after the update statement has completed execution.

question: Which of the following statements are correct regarding a functional interface?
answer_1: It has exactly one method and it must be abstract.
answer_2: It has exactly one method and it may or may not be abstract.
answer_3: It must have exactly one abstract method and may have other default or static methods.
answer_4: It must have exactly one static method and may have other default or abstract methods.
correct_answer: It must have exactly one abstract method and may have other default or static methods.

question: Compared to public, protected, and private accessibilities, default accessibility is....
answer_2: More restrictive than public, but less restrictive than protected.
answer_3: More restrictive than protected, but less restrictive than private.
answer_4: Less restrictive than protected from within a package, and more restrictive than protected from outside a package.
correct_answer: More restrictive than protected, but less restrictive than private.
